creator.name: Districtscommissarissen / Drostambt Nickerie
creator.his_func: Regulations for the administration of the Nickerie district were drawn up in 1836. The District Commissioner received his instructions from the Governor. He occupied himself among other things with the maintenance of law and order, public health, contacts with Amerindians and labour relations. After the abolition of slavery in July 1863 there were 15 districts in Suriname. The largest was Nickerie.
